alert.note: Alert for Dunklin; Pemiscot (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 12 at 8:01AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas, including the following counties, Craighead, Greene, Mississippi and Poinsett and Southeast Missouri, including the following counties, Dunklin and Pemiscot. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 801 AM CST, the public reported heavy rain in the advisory area. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jonesboro, Paragould, Blytheville, Osceola, Trumann, Gosnell, Manila, Marked Tree, Harrisburg, Steele, Bono, Lake City, Leachville, Lepanto, Bay, Brookland, Monette, Caraway, Luxora and Keiser. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
